Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: matzo \matz"o\, matzoh \matz"oh\, n.; pl. E. {matzos} or {matzohs}; Hebr. {matzoth} [Heb. matsts[=o]th, pl. of matsts[=a]h unleavened.] A cake of unleavened bread eaten by the Jews at the feast of the Passover. [1913 Webster]
matzo n : brittle flat bread eaten at Passover [syn: {matzoh}, {matzah}, {unleavened bread}] [also: {matzoth} (pl)]
